title: Men's Fashion & Grooming
description: Developing a personal style is about more than just clothes; it's about presenting the best version of yourself. From office wear to festive occasions, here's a guide to men's style in India.
sentences: A well-fitting wardrobe is key. It's better to have fewer, well-fitting clothes than many ill-fitting ones.
Master the basics: solid-colored t-shirts (white, black, grey), dark-wash jeans, and a versatile pair of chinos form the foundation.
Ethnic wear like a crisp kurta-pyjama or a Nehru jacket can be a stylish choice for festivals and weddings.
Invest in good quality footwear; a pair of classic white sneakers, formal leather shoes, and comfortable sandals are essential.
Basic grooming, including a neat haircut, trimmed beard or clean shave, and clean nails, is fundamental to good style.
dos: Pay attention to your footwear; clean and appropriate shoes can elevate any outfit.
Understand your body type and choose clothes that are flattering.
Accessorize thoughtfully with a good watch, a simple belt, or sunglasses.
Iron your clothes. A wrinkle-free outfit instantly looks more put-together.
donts: Don't wear clothes with overly large logos or loud prints for formal occasions.
Don't ignore the fit; avoid clothes that are too baggy or too tight.
Don't wear sports shoes with formal or ethnic wear.
Don't overdo it with cologne or deodorant.
